description: The Blue Atlas Cedar (Cedrus atlantica 'Glauca') is a stunning conifer that is hardy and easy to grow. It is native to the Atlas Mountains of Algeria and Morocco and is known for its eye catching powder blue foliage. It is both drought and cold tolerant, growing to heights of up to 80 feet tall, with a pyramidal shape. Its foliage is evergreen so it brings color to the garden all year round. It is widely used as an ornamental tree, as it is strikingly beautiful and needs very low maintenance. A perfect addition to anyoneâ€™s garden.
